action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish a Federal Advisory Committee on Women in Aviation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Women in Aviation Advisory Board Act.

section.header: Federal advisory committee on women in aviation

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall establish a Federal Advisory Committee on Women in Aviation (in this section referred to as the Committee).

The Committee shall advise the Secretary of Transportation and the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration on matters related to the education, training, mentorship, outreach, recruitment, and retention of women in the aviation industry.
The Secretary of Transportation shall establish in the Department of Transportation an office to provide administrative and logistical support to the Committee.
Not later than 90 days after the establishment of the Committee under subsection (a), the Secretary of Transportation shall—

paragraph.text: appoint members of the Committee, including not less than one representative from each of the following, including—

subparagraph.text: manufacturers of aircraft, avionics, propulsion systems, and air traffic management systems;
commercial air carriers, general aviation operators, and unmanned aircraft systems operators;
certified labor representatives of pilots, flight attendants, air traffic control specialists employed by the Federal Aviation Administration, aircraft mechanics, aviation safety inspectors;
institutions of higher education and aviation trade schools; and
nonprofit organizations within the aviation industry;

paragraph.text: invite the heads of each of the following departments or agencies to designate not less than 1 representative to participate on the Committee, including—

subparagraph.text: the National Aeronautics and Space Administration; and
any other departments or agencies as the Secretary determines appropriate; and

paragraph.text: invite the Chair of the Committee to appoint up to 6 additional members approved by the Committee to ensure balanced representation from the aviation industry, labor stakeholders, and stakeholder associations.

subsection.text: The Committee shall select a member to serve as Chairperson and shall select such subcommittee chairs as the Committee may require.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2), members of the Committee shall be appointed for 6 year terms.
Members appointed under subsection (d)(14) shall serve for a 2 year term.
In the case of a member resigning, dying, or otherwise becoming incapable of serving on the Committee, the Chair shall appoint a member to serve for the remaining period of the term.
Upon the expiration of a term of a member of the Committee, such member may serve until a replacement member is appointed under subsection (d).
Not later than 90 days after receiving notice of a vacancy in the Committee, the Chair shall fill the vacancy in the same manner as the original appointment.
shall meet not less than 2 times per year; and
may conduct business through public hearings, site visits, briefings, and other activities determined appropriate by the Committee.

subsection.text: Not less than once per year, the Committee shall submit to the Secretary of Transportation, the Chair of the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, and the Chair of the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report describing the activities and recommendations of the Committee.

paragraph.text: Committee members shall serve without compensation.
The members shall be allowed travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, at rates authorized for employees of agencies under subchapter I of chapter 57 of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: Section 14 of the Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 App. U.S.C.) shall not apply to the committee.
